bibl.title: Territory of Washington v James Sheridan. Attorney Statement
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: Washington State Archives, Eastern Regional Branch
msIdentifier.collection: Walla Walla County Government; Clerk, Territorial Court Civil/Criminal Case Files, 1860-1889

div1.p: Filed May 4th, 1863 B. N. Sexton Clerk
Territory of Washington County of Walla Walla
In the Distri t Court First Judicial District
And now comes the Defat. and his Atty. Sherman moved the quash the morel manl found in the above Entitled cause- be cause- the same was not found by say a legally- instituted grand jurt - in this-
In his cptty month found in the same was constituted
That the original panel of grand jurors was dismissed by order of- Court - without being first challeneged by any,

2nd- That after the dismissal of the said first panel of grand jurors- the Court directed the Sheriff to summons the and and identical individuals who composed the first panel as the grand jury and that therefore they were impanelled - sworn & charged-
